article_title: FCA Case Will Likely Set Standard On ACA Overpayments
article_text:
FCA Case Will Likely Set Standard On ACA Overpayments

Law360, New York (November 17, 2014, 10:54 AM ET) -- A high-profile False Claims Act lawsuit is in full swing in the Southern District of New York. The lawsuit began as a whistleblower qui tam suit against Continuum Health Partners Inc., but recently the U.S. Department of Justice intervened in the dispute.



The crux of the lawsuit centers on what events trigger the start of the 60-day clock for a health care provider to return Medicaid overpayments under the Affordable Care Act. The court’s ruling on a motion to dismiss that was just filed in the...

To view the full article, register now.

article_metadata.description: A New York federal court's ruling on the motion to dismiss that was just filed in the False Claims Act suit against Continuum Health Partners Inc. will most likely set forth some needed guidance as to what kind of factual scenario triggers the start date for the Affordable Care Act’s 60-day overpayment rule, say Bill Mateja and Mike Nammar of Fish & Richardson PC.
